sentence.Network_en: She put up with it all stoically.

sentence.Network_cn: 他淡然地接受了所有的苦难.

sentence.Network_en: The boy stood stoically while she spun nonsense.
sentence.Network_cn: 她正在胡诌一通的时候,那个孩子纹丝不动地站在那里.

RelatedPhrase.word: win her over stoically or platonically

list.key: win her over stoically or platonically
list.abs: certainly , we don't know if a pig who kidnaps a girl will try to win her over stoically or platonically .当然，我们并不知道劫持了女孩的猪究竟会不会设法去俘获女孩的心。
He stoically accepted all suffering ., 他淡然地接受了所有的苦难.

entry.tran: 坚忍的;坦然的;不以为苦的
entry.def: If you say that someone behaves in a stoical way, you approve of them because they do not complain or show they are upset in bad situations.

example.ex: She never ceased to admire the stoical courage of those in Northern Ireland...
example.tran: 她一直很敬佩爱尔兰北部人民的坚忍和勇敢。

example.ex: He had been stoical at their parting.
example.tran: 他们分手时他表现得很坦然。

means.word_mean: 1. without emotion; in a stoic manner;

auth_sentence.content: One aspect of Oldham's appeal was always his stoically lo-fi stance.
auth_sentence.res_content: One aspect of Oldham's appeal was always his stoically lo-fi stance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One aspect of Oldham's appeal was always his stoically lo-fi stance.

auth_sentence.content: "It will take time and experience," Khairallah said stoically.

auth_sentence.content: Sherman argues that toughing it out stoically is both a blessing and a curse.
